attributes.action: automate the tube network to reduce the impact of frequently-striking, overpaid workers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The DLR (Docklands Light Railway) is a smooth-running, consistent service - no doubt due to its automation. Unfortunately it only covers a quarter of London.

The trains are driver-less. That means that there are no drivers to go on strike, or demand exorbitant wage increases at the commuters' expense 

This is a petition to request expansion of the DLR network, or automation of the existing tube network for the benefit of London commuters. We are suffering a service increasingly disrupted by striking workers, and would benefit hugely from a technical solution.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
